page.title: 01Introduction, N. Rangeworthy
page.content: {This area covers}the northern part of Rangeworthy village and the hamlets of Bagstone and West End. The countryside consists almost entirely of flattish grassland broken up by hedges, stone walls and clumps of deciduous trees. There is higher ground to the East as you approach the Cotswold Hills. {Both Rangeworthy and Bagstone}are rather linear in character running alongside the Wotton Road with farms and other buildings scattered over the rest of the countryside. There is a church, a school, a hotel, a public house,nurseries and a garage but no shops in this particular area. {Many of the houses}are old but most have been renovated and many extended. There is very little new building. There are a few long-established local families but also many newcomers who have moved in in recent years.
